intro: Crepinia subnitens, commonly known as the narrow-leaved crepe jasmine, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Crepinia subnitens is often cultivated for its ornamental value and pleasant scent.
